intro: Scabiosa grisea, commonly known as the gray scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. Scabiosa grisea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
